alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:47PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN MONROE AND SOUTHERN NOBLE COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM EDT... At 747 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Caldwell, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Caldwell, Dudley, Summerfield, Belle Valley, Dexter City, Stafford, Harriettsville, and Wolf Run State Park. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 18 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Ohio.
